result.execSummary:
All charges against Mark A. Bradshaw in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark A. Bradshaw is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A. Bradshaw

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mark A. Bradshaw in court.  Attorney David Patton in court for Mark A. Bradshaw.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  On state's motion, case dismissed.  Bond shall remain posted pending SEH in 21CF1282.
Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Patton.   Clerk HMcBride.  PLEAH 9/14 1:30pm. Bond continued.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Patton.   Clerk HMcBride. State requests last adjmt for discussions with defense.  Granted. If no plea at next hearing, case will be set for trial.  FPT 8/4 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

*Amended**
 No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Angela P

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Patton.   Clerk HMcBride.   Atty Patton moves for modification to SB.   State objects.  Court hears argument.  Court denies request for SB. Court modifies to $500 CB with same conditions.   DE requests ability to retrieve items from victim's residence.  Court orders third party be allowed to retrieve DE's items - worked out between Atty Patton and Vic Wit office - third party shall be approved by the victim and exchange shall be scheduled within two weeks from today.  PTC 5/10 1:30pm.
4/12 MH moved up to 1:30pm. Attys notified by email this day.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond - filed by Atty David Patton - 4/12 2pm.

Defendant Mark A. Bradshaw appeared with Attorney David Patton.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Angela P

152PM   Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson.  Victim A.P.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on March 23, 2022 at 09:45 am. $2500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Court dismissed count 2 today.  sg
